3: The wasteland is as silent as always.
It does not question, nor does it answer. It does not think and is never confused.
Above the wasteland is an ever-changing landscape, but the wasteland itself never changes.
However, the will to rise above it all is not immutable.
One has to plan, think, and act for it to happen.
One who is above the wasteland has an ambition and is preparing to effect change—
Cinderelik.
Yes?
I have a mission for you.
At the same time, there is a gray figure roaming the wasteland.
The wasteland has always been an unfriendly place to lonesome travelers, especially after the Punishing Virus outbreak. The Corrupted who linger here makes this place even more dangerous.
The gray figure continues walking the wasteland, and the Corrupted pause and hesitate, their instincts resisting the Punishing Virus's desire for destruction.
The traveler is neither human nor beast, neither a Construct of Babylonia, nor a Corrupted like them.
She is a higher being.
The gray figure keeps walking on, and this pitch-black world stares at her silently in awe as it makes way for her.
On this road, lies the disfigured remnants of a body.
The traveler goes up to it and cups the broken face in the palm of her hands.
She sees a wound across the mechanical body, and another. The upper and lower part of the body are barely held together by the broken spine.
She sees that its mangled right hand is still tightly gripping a pair of weapons that could be scythes or guns.
This body seems to have gone through hell, holding on to its final obsession and perseverance, and falls on the path forward—at least, that is what the traveler thinks.
What did the path ahead hold for him?
The traveler has asked many people that question, and has received different answers.
The traveler fully accepts their dreams, obsessions, hopes and despair.
Is there something you wanted to do?
...I see.
No one knows what words the traveler hears from the body, or perhaps the traveler does not expect an answer from it.
In any case, what is done is done.
